website_summaries.verdict: Very versatile in terms of the angles you can set it at, although it isn't as rugged as other models.
pros: Bolt-on assembly improves stability and deters thieves
Can buy spare parts in case of breakage
cons: Glass in the mirror is very susceptible to breaking if you hit it or the bike tips over
Plastic casing is prone to cracking over time or while installing

customer_reviews.title: Total cheap garbage glass that shatters on the slightest drop...
customer_reviews.text: These mirrors are horrible. I just bought my second one and it dropped during assembly, and the glass instantly shattered, on a non-concrete floor no less. Sadly, this was the second one of these I bought to replace the first one I bought because the glass also shattered in that one from a simple drop. These mirrors are made of super cheap glass and break from the slightest drop impact. Why would you want such cheap glass on something like a bicycle that is specifically made to be dropped, banged around, etc...
customer_reviews.author: COShopper

customer_reviews.title: It BROKE
customer_reviews.text: Poor material formulation/casting led to mirror mount fracturing. The idea and functionality is great but the part that supports the mirror split on both sides of the mold seam. This failure made it impossible to secure the mirror in place. Being a 71 year old 'fix-it' guy the repair was straight forward (for me). The mirror had been installed a short time ago, but was over the Amazon return period. The idea and design is top notch, but at the time my unit was produced, something was not to spec and products produced were SUB-PAR. Purchase with caution and be prepared to fix or return.
customer_reviews.author: mrgizmow

customer_reviews.title: Hardware does not fit company won’t accept returns
customer_reviews.text: How how how does this piece of junk have so many good reviews?! First of it comes in abou 10 pieces. How hard would it be to send an assembled mirror? It wouldn’t be a big deal except the hardware included does not fit the product. It is impossible to put together bc of this. I tried to return but this company apparently does not accept returns even on defective products. So disappointed. I’m throwing this in the trash :(
customer_reviews.author: Jennie

customer_reviews.title: Super mirror, worth the cost.
customer_reviews.text: Good, solid, very adjustable. It is slightly convex, allowing for a safe view of what is behind. A friend had one, on which the mirror broke (the one in my pictures). I mounted mine so it hangs down, and in toward the bike. This way it "looks" under your arm, straight back... you don't have to move your arm to see back. ALSO, it is not nearly as vulnerable to hitting or being hit by things when you're riding in the brush. Beautiful product, NO downside I can find. Worth the extra cost over the cheapies.
customer_reviews.author: downhiller

customer_reviews.title: An important bike accessory
customer_reviews.text: As some others have noted, installation of this mirror takes a little time and effort, but really is not a problem. As for its utility, it's darn near perfect. Easy to adjust, keeps its positioning reliably, and looks nice on the bike. I considered getting a helmet-mounted mirror, but am glad I went with this instead -- the image is good-sized and you don't have to hold your head in exactly the right position to see behind you the way you do with a helmet mounted unit. And if you don't use some kind of mirror, you're an idiot. Being hit by a car you didn't realize was behind you is a preventable accident you really don't want to happen.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: Poor design. The dimensions chosen + using a round mirror mean that it is impossible to use this swiveled above the grip because there is no room for you hand to fit under the mirror. If the riser was 1" longer it would work. So unless you do what I did and go to the hardware store and get a nylon spacer and longer bolt, you will have to settle for a mirror that sticks way out past your handlebars
customer_reviews.author: MrBill

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend bike mirrors if you ride in the city.
customer_reviews.text: I have two bikes. I liked this mirror so much I decided to buy a second. This mirror because it is set off on the end of the bars, allowing good rear vision as well as keeping clutter off the handlebars. It does add a inch to the width of the bars, so going through narrow spaces like door ways and tight areas can be a bit of a nuisance. For the record I'm stingy when it comes to handing out 5 stars. To meet that standard a product has to go well beyond my expectations. That being said, this mirror is a good value and can possibly save you life.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Pix

customer_reviews.title: Mirror is just what i needed.
customer_reviews.text: When I received this mirror I was not impressed. It came in about 7 pieces not counting screws and washers. But its simple to put together and I was surprised by how well this small mirror lets me see what is behind me. I even had the bike accidently tip over and mirror simply turned at the elbow of arm and mirror was undamaged. Im satisfied with this product. Update: this mirror is almost indestructible. My heavy Sondors ebike has fallen on this mirror 4 times now and mirror has survived all 4 times and once I hit a post with it. I have ordered 2 more and every bike has one on it.
customer_reviews.author: Just Ed

customer_reviews.title: Better than the helmet mounted mirror
customer_reviews.text: I tried both the helmet mounted mirror and this mirror. I like this mirror better. Once you get it adjusted for your typical riding position it is just a glance to see what is behind you (I tightened mine and haven't noticed it getting loose and several miles of my typical ride is on gravel). I spent several rides trying to fine tune the helmet mounted mirror and could never get it exactly where I could just glance over (always had to tilt my head and couldn't get the mirror mounted in the right spot). I like this mirror also for it's larger size. My only gripe with this mirror is it had a small smudge that I cannot clean/remove.
customer_reviews.author: Dotnet

customer_reviews.title: NOT A TRUE SIZE IMAGE
customer_reviews.text: Before purchasing this I queried customer reviews to find out if it the mirror produced a true size image. Seller responded and stated that it did. After purchasing, it became apparent that seller clearly misrepresented the product as this is completely not true. The first box on the instructions is a "WARNING" which states, "This is a convex mirror and it makes an object appear smaller and more distant than the object really is.". This means a car or other cyclist would almost be upon me before discern-ability in the mirror. Highly recommend seller read their instructions before advising potential customers. Notwithstanding, the image is clear but that is also true of other bicycle mirrors.
customer_reviews.author: Boo

customer_reviews.title: Great mirror
customer_reviews.text: I have a radrover ebike. I wanted a mirror to see approaching traffic. so i ordered really cool looking mirrors. They looked great on the bike. However they were useless. I could see my arms, lol. So i had to look at other options. This mirror mounts very easily to the end of the the handlebar, I was fortunate that i did not need to cut the grips. I only needed to remove the end cap. I carry an allen wrench in case it loosens but haven't needed it yet. I would definitely recommend this. I think once my wife checks it out i may have to purchase another one anyway :)
customer_reviews.author: goosepappa

customer_reviews.title: Great mirror for seeing what is behind you as you ride.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mirror for my wife’s bike. It was easy to install, and if I leave just a little play in the adjustment, she can move it if needed. She first used it mounted up and out to the left side. It worked great, however, she felt uncomfortable when on a bike path because it caused the mirror to stick out and take up more space. I adjusted it down and to the inside, and now she feels more relaxed. I have been using a 3rd eye mirror that attaches to my sun glasses. After seeing her mirror in the new position, I bought two more from Amazon and mounted them on my bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Grandpa & Grandma B

customer_reviews.title: Could not ask for any more for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I received exactly what I expected to receive and it works flawlessly. Zero complaints and I am about to order half a dozen more for other bikes now that I have had one in hand to inspect and use for a couple of weeks.I have to admit I got quite a laugh after reading the negative review from people who are too stupid to put this simple unit together. don't understand that the screw are supposed to be hard to put in, or blame the quality of manufacture when the GLASS mirror shatters when they dropped it. Hilarious!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: too small
customer_reviews.text: Even the smaller diameter wedge didn't fit well on my Kona mountain bike. Because some of the other components fit so tightly, I really tried to get it in there and it busted after the 100th hit with my mallet. The wedge *was* going in but the fit was too tight. Part of the directions say not to worry about breaking components on instillation (due to tight fit). Well, not 100% on that guidance. Do not recommend for Kona's. Now I have to figure out how to get it out of there half busted and find and pay for another option. Boooooo
customer_reviews.author: Sean P Dodds

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and great visibility
customer_reviews.text: This mirror has great visibility. I have had it for 6 months now. Once it is mounted it is steady but easy to readjust while riding if needed. It was easy to install. In my case I did have to cut the end of the rubber on the handlebar to install it, but I do not notice it. I would but it again if I needed it.
customer_reviews.author: Simplify

customer_reviews.title: The Mirrycle MTB Bar End Mirror is Working Great on My Catrike Dumont Trike Right Side
customer_reviews.text: The Mirrycle MTB Bar End Mirror works great for my right hand side of my Catrike Dumont needed a mirror. This product fits very well for my needs. It supplies very good viability to the rear and matches the original that came with my trike. All in all this is a great product for the money. Much less cost compared to the bike manufacture for the exact same product. It is well worth a full 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best mirror I've found
customer_reviews.text: I have no vision in my left eye, so when driving a car I mostly use the right hand mirror. Since you normally ride on the edge of the road, right side mirrors don't help much & other left side mirrors I've tried mostly show my body & my left arm. With this mirror I'm able to know what's behind me, which is important as some drivers don't seem to recognize my right to be on the road. I would much rather pull of on the shoulder & let someone past as get hit.
customer_reviews.author: Ratman2455

customer_reviews.title: Bicycle mirror
customer_reviews.text: Excellent mirror. The threads were very very tight! This is due to either the cooling plastic constricting the brass threaded inserts or a deliberate tightness by design. The tightness bothered me so I tapped all threads with an 8-32 tap. I would rather have the threads loose so that adjustment may easily be made and not break the mirror when it is inadvertently bumped. This will happen because it sticks way out beyond the handlebar. The glass mirror is great and remains clear. It it relatively cheap and easy to replace if it breaks. Looseness of the threads does not seem to be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: ghandalf

customer_reviews.title: Best for bike safety.
customer_reviews.text: I ride on streets and use on both ends of handlebars for unsurpassed visibility behind me. You only have to adjust for your riding position. Only mild complaint is with both mirrors on slightly difficult to get through a doorway. I would never trust any other mirrors to work as well. Must also recommend in the strongest terms to also have bright flashing front and rear lights at all times.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Meek

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable on the fly
customer_reviews.text: This is designed so that it can be adjusted after installation without tools and without loosening up. The screws are a tight fit in the built-in nuts so that you can tighten the joints most of the way, then make minor adjustments without anything loosening up. I often swing the mirror inboard for parking the bike, then rotate it back out when I start riding--in seconds, without tools. I would love to have a flat (not convex) mirror, but this one does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Great Mirror!
customer_reviews.text: It's well made. I took off two stars for the following reasons: 1. The screws would not fit in the bras inserts. I had to tap them. Once I did that, everything went together beautiful. I have a machine shop. Where's the average guy going to get a tap? 2. The screws were zinc plated. They nicely gave stainless steel washers and then crappy zinc screws. Sooner or later the bike will get wet, and the screws will corrode. Come on guys step up. You're 2 cents short of a dollar on quality. It adjusts fine an fits nicely on my Trek bike. Mirror is 3.25" in diameter which is a good size for me.
customer_reviews.author: Brucew

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Mirror
customer_reviews.text: This mirror was very easy to install, but best of all it provides an excellent clear view of what is behind me. This is the best bike mirror I have ever used. The size of the mirror and the clarity of the view is outstanding. I would highly recommend this mirror. I have not had any issues with the mirror vibrating out of position, as the connection to the handlebar is very secure and the pivot adjustment on the mirror stem is also very snug. It is easy to adjust but holds that position well.
customer_reviews.author: Mister Fixit

customer_reviews.title: Good mirror!!
customer_reviews.text: Comes with clear instructions for attaching the mirror. I mounted it pointing forward somewhat, and it gives me a clear view. As per the instructions, don’t use lubricant on the cap screws thread into he brass threaded inserts. Tighten them slowly, and steady and it will stay where set but still be adjustable. Don’t use loctite on any of the threads either. Most varieties of loctite react badly with plastics and cause the plastic to soften and fail. Best of all, “Made in the USA”.
customer_reviews.author: DavidH

customer_reviews.title: A good bike accessory for safety
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Myrrcle bike mirror. The first two broke when my bike fell over, and so I thought I'd try one of those eyeglass/helmet mounted mirrors. This seemed to work OK, but over time I found myself constantly adjusting it and it was hard to just glance at to see behind. Maybe it was my eyes. In any case, I decided to ditch this and go with another Myrrcle. The Myrrcle is the best. It's easy to see, has a wide field of vision, doesn't seem to vibrate much, and is really clear. It's also very easy to install. I'm going to try my best to keep this one intact (by not letting my bike fall over!).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very important for more safety when you ride!
customer_reviews.text: I have these mirrors on all of my bikes. I just purchased another for my newest bike, an electric bike. They are easy to install. The company has an excellent video on line with installation instructions. If you love bike riding, as I do, this is must for safety. Also, please, wear BRIGHT COLORS when you ride and have good, BRIGHT, FLASHING LIGHTS, front and rear. It's NOT cool to be wearing all black and have no lights flashing. CARS CAN'T SEE YOU! Please, be safe out there .. too many nutty, distracted drivers on the road. 1,000 bicyclists are killed every year. Don't become a statistic.
customer_reviews.author: looking further

customer_reviews.title: They work better than any other mirror I've owned
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased at least five of this model mirror, over the last several years, to go on several different bikes. They work better than any other mirror I've owned, and are rugged. I've never had the glass part crack, even after hitting posts, while riding, with the back side of mirror. I have had to replace the stem piece that fits up inside the handlebars, after a bike fell over on the mirror, and another time when the mirror hit a post. But over all, I think this is a excellent bicycle mirror.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: It's a good mirror
customer_reviews.text: Quality components, easy to assemble and install. You can tighten the arm joints it as much as you need. My joints tightened just enough so that they don't move when the bike is jostled around on bumpy terrain, but just loose enough that I can give it quick adjustments. The design is a bit awkward. Don't know why they didn't use a single ball-style joint instead of the three joints it has now, but this is not enough to take off any points. Good mirror.
customer_reviews.author: J. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Wicked good product, great field of view.
customer_reviews.text: I'm eating crow because of my previous negative beliefs about handlebar mirrors.This one is fantastic, it gives me a great view of the street on my 6, no more being snuck up on by ultra quiet cars. I used to ride with a helmet mounted mirror which was harder to adjust but easier to glance at, but like I said, this handlebar mirror is way better than I expected it to be and than the helmet one I had because it lets me see the whole street. And, BONUS, made in the USA! Another ride or two and I expect to be fully adjusted to glancing down at the mirror instead of forward
customer_reviews.author: SuperTeacher

customer_reviews.title: Nice and stable
customer_reviews.text: Love this mirror. I previously had one from Walmart that attached with a velcro strap. It was never in place, always twisting and sliding. Eventually it either fell of or got stolen. This new one is stable and easy to view. Only problem was the bolts were too tight for the plastic inserts which would have broken the plastic so ran a tap in them so that the bolts would go in easier. Don't know if they are all like this or mine was a fluke.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy F

customer_reviews.title: The best rear view mirror out there
customer_reviews.text: I used to use one of those helmet mount wire mirrors with a postage stamp mirror on the end. That was 50 years ago, when that was about all that was available. Since then, I have probably used these on eight bicycles and a trike. They are absolutely the best of the best. Easy to install, very secure and easy to make small adjustments, which are rarely needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can be used with ergonomic grips
customer_reviews.text: I bought one to use on my wife's bike with her Velo ergonomic grips and liked it so much that I bought another. I had to drill a hole in the end but that was straight forward using a unibit. I'm happy with these so far and have hit them on bridge rails, the car, other bikes, children's heads, the car again, and pretty much everything I get near. The mirrors are still intact and go back in position easily.
customer_reviews.author: Zero

customer_reviews.title: Good product but slightly distorted image
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid mirror, small but adequate (much like the majority of bike mirrors). It stays in place, can be adjusted easily, and extends from the handlebar an appropriate distance. It does make objects look farther away than they really are. At dusk, it is especially hard to gauge distances. I've not seen any other bike mirrors that are different in this respect.
customer_reviews.author: David Bruck

customer_reviews.title: Nice mirror, easy to mount and has good stability
customer_reviews.text: This works well as a mirror, and stays stable even after adjusting while tightened and with vibration. The low-rated reviews that say the screws are too tight or tried using different screws with locktite are due to not reading the instruction sheet, which says the screws are intentional tight. There are only two degrees of motion (tilting vertically and rotating the arm) and no side to side tilt, but because of the wide angle, I was able to get a good view anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Hanko

customer_reviews.title: Just take a tool with you on the first ride out and micro-adjust to the perfect position. I wish there was a quick release ...
customer_reviews.text: I have two--one on my road bike with a t-bar and a folding bike. It's a small mirror meant to show you if there's a vehicle behind you. It's not to be so sharp or large you can read license plates or see someone's eye color. Just take a tool with you on the first ride out and micro-adjust to the perfect position. I wish there was a quick release version so I can take it off the folding bike when needed. Currently, I can fold the bike with the mirror attached--but very carefully. For a smaller footprint, I only use the vertical arm.
customer_reviews.author: tdonline

customer_reviews.title: Great mirrors!
customer_reviews.text: Have used these mirrors for years and love them. They require semi-frequent hand adjustments and occasional hex tightening but nothing too onerous—much easier and more reliable than the clamp-on mirror I had used before. I commute on my bike and find these pretty invaluable in helping me to stay aware. The positioning at bar-end is good, and they provide a wide enough view to be very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Was good until the mirror got unglued
customer_reviews.text: I was really happy with this product. The mirror itself is very good, it is small but enables you to see a large area behind you. The installation was easy and it is sturdily fixed onto the bike. You can adjust it easily and select the right angles, but it doesn't move by itself while you are riding. But suddenly the mirror detached, which was when I understood that it is glued to its support (see attached photo). I bought it in April 2017, but still, I am a bit disappointed that it didn't last longer.
customer_reviews.author: THRIFTY LAWYER

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and install, stays in place, easy to adjust and rotate. Gives great side and rear visibility. As other users have noted, when assembling, the pieces are a bit stiff/tight to screw together, but it needs to be tight fitting so the mirror does not vibrate loose and flop around. With a proper screwdriver, I had no problem assembling this mirror. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Darryl C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for riding in traffic
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install on my Aventon Level 3 E-Bike with the included hex tool. Pop off the plastic cap on the end of the handlebar, slip in the grip-nut and tighten. Offers a good rear view and can be adjusted while riding if you don't lock it down too tightly. It would probably break if the bike fell over on that side, but otherwise I think it is an excellent value for the price. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: W. Koep

customer_reviews.title: Great product great price
customer_reviews.text: Decent quality. Very useful for rearward visibility. Stable. Easy instructions. Follow the instructions. Especially the part about the cap screws being slightly difficult to install. They’re designed that way to stay tight. Very happy with purchase. I’m ordering another for my wife’s ebike. Made in USA!!!
customer_reviews.author: Shelley A. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Mirrycle MTB handlebar mounted mirror.
customer_reviews.text: Have used this mirror on a Del Sol bike for a couple of months. It is easy to install, adjust, and use. I used this mirror in combination with a helmet mounted mirror for the first month. The Mirrycle was easier to use, I removed the mirror from my helmet and only use the Mirrycle now. As others have said it was necessary to enlarge the hole in my left handlebar grip in order to install the Mirrycle.
customer_reviews.author: Sky Watcher Sam

customer_reviews.title: Great mirror, well worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the bicycle I use to commute to the train station. To say it is a lifesaver would be accurate, it makes me feel much safer knowing what is coming from behind while riding on some narrow roads. The mounting was very simple, it did require me to cut a small hole in the end of the handlebar grip but it works great, very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: StefieJ

customer_reviews.title: Designed well, built well, works well!
customer_reviews.text: Designed well, built well, works well! I feel so much happier and safer riding on the road with this mirror. It lets me see who/what is coming up on me. Should be a must for every road warrior! update: Still using it a couple of months and many miles later. Can't imagine riding without it. It would be like driving without rear view mirrors. This particular mirror is very well made and holds position perfectly, yet is easy to move or adjust if necessary. Possibly a perfect product. I don't get to say that often...
customer_reviews.author: Mike Schaffer

customer_reviews.title: Works for me.  E-bike used daily (in summer) on streets and short section of highway, and
customer_reviews.text: Works for me. E-bike used daily (in summer) on streets and short section of highway, and daily commute to yoga. Took some adjustment to get it just right, but is now solid and very useful. Don't have to turn my head now to check behind me. Surprisingly clear image, with just the right amount of curve in mirror surface. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Winafew

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Loved the sturdy mount. Cheaper oners I have purchased were loose after a couple of months with no way to tighten the adjustments. This one stays put where you tighten it. Only wish i hadn't bought the convex mirror that distorts distance. It makes it almost impossible to tell how far the vehicle is behind you with the mirror vibrating while riding. Need to order the flat mirror for this style.
customer_reviews.author: Art G.

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't make it fit the handle bar
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the look and style of this mirror, and I have a few friends who purchased this same item. So, I purchased one hoping to install it on my bike. Of the two wedges that go inside the handle, one was too small and the other too large. So, I cannot make it stay in place. To be fair, this may speak more to my skill set than to the item, but I just can't seem to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Teezbug

customer_reviews.title: Great mirror. This morning I also was able check ...
customer_reviews.text: Great mirror. This morning I also was able check this mirror, recognize the car behind me (driving 50 mph) didn't see me and swerve to avoid being hit. It really saved my bacon. Some of the screws have to be tightened a lot, which turns out to be a good thing. The mirror is solid, won't move or change positions because it secures so well. I also laid down my bike on the side this mirror was on and outside of being slightly readjusted because of the crash, nothing was damaged (wish I could say the same for me!), which was quite the surprise. Can't recommend this mirror enough!
customer_reviews.author: Alex Denning

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I like it even though it is a convex mirror ("things in the mirror are closer than they appear"). In the past I've used nearly identical mirrors of the same brand and price and they have worked out great... just be careful the mirror doesn't hit anything or that the bike doesn't fall over because I have broken the glass in one of them before. I still prefer this style because the image is much clearer than other types of "mirrors".
customer_reviews.author: Straight Forward Review

customer_reviews.title: Skeptical at First, but It Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit put off when I first received this several weeks ago... it appeared to be just a cheap plastic product. The instructions also tell you to double up the washers on the stem, with the result that you can't tighten it enough to stop it from being moved without breaking it... But, that's the beauty of it... The joints are just stiff enough to hold their position without moving or shaking while riding, but still allow easy adjustment, and will swing out of the way if they're brushed by someone waling past it.
customer_reviews.author: Old Geezer

customer_reviews.title: Great Mirror
customer_reviews.text: I had a mirror like this on my EZ Racer recumbent but it was damaged in a wreck. I not only ordered one to replace the damaged one, I ordered one to mount on my Cannondale cadd8 road bike. This is absolutely the best mirror there is for handlebar mount. The one I replaced on my road bike cost twice as much at my LBS and did not give me a good view behind me. This is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Piedpiper46

customer_reviews.title: Great visibility behind you while biking
customer_reviews.text: I love this mirror. I bike daily and I gives me great visibility of whats going on behind me. It comes with 2 pieces to install on diferent sized handlebars. I installed it on my old bike initially. I bought a new Trek Verve Women’s bike and used the other piece to install it because the handlebars were a different width. Easy to install. Easy to adjust the position. I turn it in when it’s in the garage so it doesn't stick out. When ready to ride, I put it in the proper position and adjust to my liking. I am happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: jamTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Solid Little Mirror With No Play
customer_reviews.text: Great little mirror for my bike with a surface area that is big enough to quickly check my blindspot. Relatively easy to install and adjust. The threads are a bit tight on the screws the first time, but with some elbow grease and a wrench to hold the mount, it comes together really solid. Once assembled, it stays rigid and doesn't shift when cruising over bumpy terrain. Make sure to use all the washers as shown in the instructions as it allows minor movement adjustments without resistance.
customer_reviews.author: Mohawk MikeTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Great Mirror
customer_reviews.text: I tried two other mirrors and they would not mount to the handlebar correctly. This mirror mounts inside the handlebar and is fairly easy to mount. It is adjustable. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amaz Customer

customer_reviews.title: don't worry about looks or weight, this mirror is essential if safety is important to you.
customer_reviews.text: There is little to no vibration with this mirror and it takes a bit of adjusting but it only has to be done once. As a 4,000 mile per year commuter, this is the most essential accessory for me, except for lights. I can see cars approaching 1/4 mile or further behind me so I can ride in the center of a road with no worries. Plus, I know exactly when I am being passed by a motorist. This mirror gives me piece of mind. It's not cool, it's ugly and very few cyclists use a mirror but it is invaluable and I will never ride again without a mirror.
customer_reviews.author: honest assessment

customer_reviews.title: A good design and quality mirror
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly this a good design and quality bicycle mirror, I didn’t expect it at all, especially because of the price. I wasn’t quite sure with other glamorous reviews I read, but now I couldn’t agree more! The instruction is clear and easy to follow, and it came with the tool. I bought another one for my wife, for her hybrid bike. Another goog thing about this mirror, based on what other reviewers wrote, you could by just the mirror if you break it and inexpensive too. No cont’s from me for now.
customer_reviews.author: Javman

customer_reviews.title: Easy and usable.
customer_reviews.text: Package arrived on time and in good shape. The mirror is almost all plastic, but seems sturdy. It came with several sizes of wedges for the inside of the bars. It definitely sticks out more and increases your width. No problem for me, I am mostly riding in town or parks, not hard core mountain biking.
customer_reviews.author: Blaine

customer_reviews.title: Watch handlebar diameter...
customer_reviews.text: Rear view mirrors are a key safety item and this mirror is one of the best - sturdy, adjustable, good field of view. I dinged it though due to the mounting system - it's designed for larger diameter handlebars, so I had to fiddle with the hardware in order to get it to fit. Fortunately I have a belt sander so I was able to grind down the plastic inside bits.
customer_reviews.author: Y. R. Wu

customer_reviews.title: The Only Mirror To Have
customer_reviews.text: Excellent mirror, being glass and not a plastic mirror surface, really makes this item top notch! I've had too many bad experiences with plastic mirror lens.....but this glass reflective mirror is just the ticket. The whole item stays put nicely....stable, clear, no wobbles, shakes, etc. I had to drill out a hole in the end of my grips on my Specialized bike (rubber comfort grips).....but no big deal.....then the Mirrycle mirror fit into the handles very snugly. The end cap covers the drilled out portion nicely.....makes a very professional looking job.
customer_reviews.author: Jump To It

customer_reviews.title: Be safe out there!
customer_reviews.text: Works great and easy to install. Keeps my safer on the road. I like it placed UNDER the handle bar’s hand grip. Takes a bit to get used to in that position, but it also keeps it from getting in the way as you move the bike around.
customer_reviews.author: Musicguy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, good mirror!
customer_reviews.text: As a lifelong rider of motorcycles, my life partner was happy when I bought him a bicycle but hated not being able to see behind him easily. The end cap on his handlebars pops right off - this goes in tight. (My bike is old, I would have had to cut or replace the grips to install this.) We used the mirror on a recent 20 mile bicycle ride and it was great. He was much more comfortable on the bike being able to quickly glance in the mirror to see traffic and others behind us while not having to turn around.
customer_reviews.author: Julie E

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Expected
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this mirror and its hardware is excellent and everything has been very well designed. I just installed it on my new mountain bike and have complete confidence in its security and strength. My only suggestion is that the mirror itself should have had a protective film on it as part of its packaging. This is a basic, modern provision with just about any other similar item.
customer_reviews.author: Perot

customer_reviews.title: Comes with extensive directions.
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was quite simple and straight forward. The mirror is quite a bit more robust than a previously purchased mirror, and secures to the inside of the handlebars firmly with no play. Purchase price was very low for the quality of the mirror. I would recommend and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: C A

customer_reviews.title: Greatly enhances my safety
customer_reviews.text: I first bought one for the left side of my handlebar. The vision is so good behind me now that I bought a second one for the right side. I can tell when traffic is coming upon me from the rear and thus don't have to turn around which at my age is difficult and for all not all that safe in my view. Easy to install if your bike has a removable handlebar end piece.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Great mirror
customer_reviews.text: I normally use a lower profile mirror on my bikes, but needed something with more articulation for a recumbent. Comes with quality hardware and two different sized inserts for handle bar mounts. Easy to adjust and stays put, glass is clear and offers a good view. Good mirror, can't go wrong with this unit
customer_reviews.author: Pop N Wood

customer_reviews.title: Only bar end mirror I've ever liked. Loved.
customer_reviews.text: It's all about the objective. You have to get the exact rear view DOF from your eye to the mirror to the following traffic, and these mirrors have it dialed. The XYZ adjustment system means you can always get the most usable setup. They offer replacement lenses, which I always have as a spare. The best.
customer_reviews.author: W. Swanton

customer_reviews.title: Great mirror
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 3 total of these, for my husband and my daughter, she rides her bike to work on busy streets and loves it. Easy to see what is behind you! Easy to install and a just. I wish i had know they sell there replacement mirrors as i had one that i tossed when the one that came on the bike cracked beyond repair, due to someone stepping on it.
customer_reviews.author: Chilly Willi

customer_reviews.title: game changer for commuting
customer_reviews.text: Everyday Boston commuter for over 30 yrs. Never used a mirror until now. WOW. I immediately have much more visibility. Bought more for family... same response! However, this mirror is not perfect. Expect to hit the mirror on door frames and other obstacles. Adjustment is essential... par for the course, but that's O.K. Inevitably this mirror will break. That's also OK. I bought a spare. After all, it's better than to cheap out on safety.
customer_reviews.author: Br. Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Gives a nice clear view of what's behind. I use it on my hybrid bike with Ergon GP5 grips and it does not interfere with any of the hand positions. I want to rate it 5 stars, because I am mostly happy with it. The only thing holding me back is that I sometimes feel I have too adjust it too often during my rides, it loses it's position pretty easily. I definitely like it much better than my helmet mirror. I'm happy enough with it that I'm not considering any more mirror options.
customer_reviews.author: L. M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice mirror BUT
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice mirror , however the the threads on the screws are very tight. I thought I must have them cross threaded. I kept on checking, after a while I just forced them on. They did not break, however I could see the plastic parts breaking with the twisting to get them on. Be careful if this happens to you, it did turn out nice. Update I did get another one for my other bike a little grease will help.
customer_reviews.author: NB

customer_reviews.title: Taxis won'e hit me anymore
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed ... now I can see what's creeping up behind me. I'll never bike without a mirror again. A little effort to install, but the instructions are good. Gives me a clear picture of the road behind me. Lots of ways to adjust the mirror, to make it perfect for my view.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Pretty happy with this thing
customer_reviews.text: Pretty happy with this thing, considering the price. It slides into the inside tube of the handlebars and holds in there by compression. When not in use you can twist it inwards. I twist it in and out a few times each day and after three weeks it's still as strong and reliable (nothing loosened) as when I first installed it. Very steady while on the road, and you can adjust the angle to however best fits your preference.
customer_reviews.author: CDW

customer_reviews.title: This mirror is wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Many people had a challenge try to screw this mirror together but I found a way that made it easy. A bike hex wrench tool, a towel to wrap around the plastic stems that form the mirror Handel and a plier to get a grip with towel so not to leave scratch’s on the plastic arms of the mirror. Once I had this it took only a couple of minutes to put together the mirror. The mirror is great and doesn’t move when riding.
customer_reviews.author: The gold

customer_reviews.title: Great little mirror. Poor handle bar attachments.
customer_reviews.text: There are two pieces that are supposed to fit tightly into the handle bar. Neither was tight at all. (Maybe a mountain bike has a smaller handle bar?) I tried several other solutions and ended up wrapping duct tape around first and then gluing with Gorilla glue. Now that makes a tight fit. It will never come out or fall down now. Works perfectly now.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: These mirrors are quality made. They are easy to install and hold very tight. The mirror is only 3 inches but it is convex so you can see cars coming. If you need a larger mirror this won't work for you. The mirror also folds out of the way and is easy to position. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Glen

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I just used the mirror for the first time today. It sure helped making sure cars were not behind me. Putting it together was not real easy for me. I think more close up pictures so you could see what you're supposed to be doing and how the parts fit together the right way. I think it will work fine as long as it is sturdy which I don't know because it's new.
customer_reviews.author: cathy k

customer_reviews.title: Pros and cons
customer_reviews.text: Pros - Easy setup - about 10 minutes - Mounts well and sturdy on my mountain bike handle bars - Easy to adjust without the need for tools; does not lose position even on bumpy routes - Cheap-looking enough to not worry about thieves snatching it Cons - I was hoping for a bit more wide-angle. But it's not that convex. Good enough though, in traffic. I'd buy this again and recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Eo

customer_reviews.title: Well made and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these for my children's bikes. They are well made and were easy to install. Most importantly, the security of being able to see cars coming from behind has made my children much more enthusiastic urban bike riders. The peace of mind I get from knowing they can safely ride and avoid riding into cars makes this product very valuable to me.
customer_reviews.author: Coach

customer_reviews.title: Can see behind myself on my bicycle-so much safer than turning my body on my bike
customer_reviews.text: Installation was a breeze (especially since my husband installed) but he did say the directions were easy to follow. I feel so much safer riding our bikes and not having to turn my head and look behind me, which when I turned my head my bike would turn too-not ideal nor safe. I can see behind us and yell “car” or ring my bell to alert the ones ahead of me that a car is coming behind us.
customer_reviews.author: JenniJ

customer_reviews.title: Be patient oh, we're in different times right now
customer_reviews.text: I was happy with the way it came but I was sad that it took so long being a Prime member oh, it actually came in the mail instead of being delivered. But we're dealing with the coronavirus so I'm very lenient and how things come to me lately! Tell Alex consideration I give that a pass
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: HUBBY PUT THESE (BOUGHT TWO) ON MY SUNCHASER FAT TAD ELECTRIC ASSIST TRIKE. IT TOOK HIM 5 MINUTES TO PUT THESE TOGETHER AND ANOTHER 5 TO PUT THESE ON THE ENDS OF THE TRIKE HANDLES. PERFECT. BUY THESE, YOU WON'T BE DISSAPOINTED. THEY DO NOT SHAKE WHEN YOU PEDAL, NOT EVEN ON BAD ROADS.
customer_reviews.author: Barbie 9

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mirror so far
customer_reviews.text: Product came a few days quicker that was promised. It mounted pretty easily on my Rad Rover ebike which has the necessary hollow handlebar for this mirror system. Follow the instructions exactly and it should work. Now I have a mirror that gives a clear view w/o my arm in the way.
customer_reviews.author: John H

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Rear View
customer_reviews.text: This mirror is large enough that I'm warned of cars coming when they are several hundred yards behind me. It was easily installed since the bike grips had a plug that was easily removed. I particularly like the unobstructed view of the road behind me.
customer_reviews.author: Bud Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Best Bicycle Mirror!
customer_reviews.text: My family and I ride bike trails frequently, and we feel good mirrors are a necessity (particularly now as COVID seems to have increased the traffic). We have tried several different mirrors over many years of biking, and none touch the Mirrcycle mirrors. The provide good viewing field, hold their position, and are easy to adjust. What more could one ask?
customer_reviews.author: B. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Well designed and a good product.
customer_reviews.text: I have three of these for my electric bikes. Well designed and provides a good view of the area behind me. Takes a few minutes to assemble. Fits tightly into the end of the bike handle... You must take out the plug that most bikes have. Tight ..but loose enough to allow adjustment. Not sure how it would hold up to impact such as if the bike hit the ground. Not expensive and I would get same as replacement if this happened.
customer_reviews.author: Sandman

customer_reviews.title: Casual rider - two thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: I ride on the side of a fairly busy road for short trips < 10 miles. This mirror was pretty easy to mount (just cut the end out of your handlebar grip and it goes in). The reflected image is very clear to me (daytime rider) and I can see cars coming from quite a distance. I’m very satisfied with the purchase and feel much better now that I’m not constantly looking back over my shoulder.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Buss

customer_reviews.title: Good size and clarity
customer_reviews.text: Good build and solid clear mirror. It's easy to adjust. It's not too big nor too small. The screws are a little tight going in the brass inserts but thats a good thing. It should keep them from going loose. I started to use locktite but didn't. I would suggest starting the screw half way down by itself to get the threads 'cut' then back it out and place it with the part it will attach. It will feel forced or cross threaded but it works.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars All Day
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, very slightly parabolic which is perfect, not too big, also perfect (eyes and ears first!) and you can put this in so many positions I guarantee there's one perfect for every rider!! You can even install it down and swung under. I have it upright but the mirror right over the end of my grip, not sticking out.
customer_reviews.author: Momma

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Durable, reliable, and excellent design. I can make multiple adjustments day after day (e.g. folding the bike mirror in and out to get it in and out of my front door easier) and it does not get loose. The mirror uses multiple washers and very stiff threaded bolts (it feels like you are stripping the threads, but as the instructions state this is the way it is designed) which helps prevent the bolts from becoming loose.
customer_reviews.author: Adam K

customer_reviews.title: Second one I've owned - Love It!
customer_reviews.text: Take your time putting it on and adjusting it so as to not strip or bend anything. Hard plastic and it holds in place extremely well. Like I said this is the second one I've owned. First one lasted years but the beach salt finally took it's toll on it.
customer_reviews.author: Jim2day

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Good value.
customer_reviews.text: Happy with it. Does its job. Installation was easy and it is easy to adjust the angle. It does feel a bit awkward tightening the screws so tight and makes a noise like it's going to break but it doesn't and it gives it enough tension to stay in place. One thing to consider is that it does make your handlebar wingspan pretty wide.. I accidentally knocked it into a fence going around somebody on a tight space. It was fine though.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Felton

customer_reviews.title: need to check your bar ends first
customer_reviews.text: These appear of adequate quality. They are all plastic however so not sure how they'll hold up to falls/drops. I ordered 2 and can't use them as there is a METAL 'snubber' in the end of my bar that locks the grip on. If I cut a hole/took out the set screw the grip would twist all around. So ordered some clamp on style.
customer_reviews.author: Zuner

customer_reviews.title: Great mirror - must have for commuters
customer_reviews.text: I bike commute and consider a mirror a necessity and this one fits perfectly into my handle bar end. I like that is comes with 2 shims and wrench to assemble it. I ride on very bumpy roads and the mirror stays in place even though I have kept the swing arm loose enough to turn the mirror inwards to fit through our gate and for parking at the bike rack. I tried using a mirror on my helmet but just couldn't get used to it. I have this mirror set so I don't have to take my eyes off the road ahead of me to see cyclists or cars coming up on me. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Yoshi!725Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: works as intended and its small
customer_reviews.text: it was easy to install, once you reviewed the installation instructions. its sturday and has good view. I like the fact that it sticks out of the bike handle and I get more of the road than my arm compared to some of the other mirrors
customer_reviews.author: The

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this mirror!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, for the price I wasn't expecting much-- but it's really sturdy and not at all "plasticky." I installed it on my new e-bike in about five minutes and just took a ride across town. You can ride with SO much more confidence when you can see what's behind you! I bought one for my wife, too. Her bike arrives tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: George Warren

customer_reviews.title: Every Bike should have this on the left handle bar
customer_reviews.text: There should be a law to mount a side view mirror on every left handle bar. My son is so much more safer now that he is using this. He took an incredibly hard spill that surprisingly didn't crush his cheek bone when he attempted to look back to see what is behind him. Helmets don't protect that area of the skull. I use this on my mountain bike used for 30 mile street riding conditioning. There are a few narrow high speed streets where this is critical to have. It is easy to install, is exceptionally well made and designed. No cons.
customer_reviews.author: Tribulation ExodusTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of positioning options
customer_reviews.text: I would like a point of articulation at the mirror mount to the support arm. However, I have found the positioning to be sufficient for now. There is no jiggle or vibration which causes visual issues. The convex shape of the lens allows a nice, wide viewing angle.
customer_reviews.author: Jerrak

customer_reviews.title: Great bicycle mirror
customer_reviews.text: Phil this is by far the best bicycle mermaid. The quality and the mirror surfers are excellent. It will break at the stem, though, if you drop it up against a hard object. It has very little vibration. It is supposed to be for Strait handlebars, but it works well on Curved road bike handlebars as well. This is my fourth curved road bike handlebars as well. This is my fourth Myrrycle mirror and they have all held up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Andra Marino

customer_reviews.title: Save your money... CHEAP JUNK.
customer_reviews.text: The mirror works GREAT... as long as it lasts. I have had TWO of these mirrors and the long arm that holds the mirror breaks VERY easily. In my experience, the average life span of these mirrors is anywhere from 3 days to a week. The mirror arm is hollow and will break after a bumpy ride or even a stiff wind! VERY DISAPPOINTED! I have since purchased a compact motorcycle mirror that is high quality aluminum and MUCH better for a mountain bike. Check it out
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S

customer_reviews.title: Adaptable, Improves Safety, No Turning Head Around
customer_reviews.text: This mirror easily attaches to end of the handle bar with adjustable corner connections. Improves bike safety and security when riding in traffic. We have them on either one or both sides of our several bikes. Doesn't depend on position of your head as visor mirrors do.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Rock

customer_reviews.title: It's great!
customer_reviews.text: Best bicycle mirror made. Stays put. Good view. Doesn't bounce on bumps. I have been using them for 30 years. If you bang into something hard the mirror breaks and you have to buy a new one. When I lived in Boulder, Colorado I went to the home office and bought just the mirror separately.
customer_reviews.author: Donald R.

customer_reviews.title: Next best safety feature after a helmet
customer_reviews.text: The mirror was easy to install and is universally adjustable, providing an unobstructed view of what's behind you. A great (necessary?) safety feature, especially for old guys like me with old inflexible necks.
customer_reviews.author: K. Neal

product_meta.title: Mirrycle MTB Bar End Mountain Bicycle Mirror
product_meta.description: View the world behind with this bar end mounted bicycle mirror.. Convex mirror with it's wide field of view is adjustable to any viewing angle. Mounts in minutes with included wrench. Fits handlebars with 15.8-23.4mm (0.62-0.92") inside diameters
feature_bullets: Three-inch round, handlebar mounted rearview mirror for bicycles
Wide view convex mirror pivots to any viewing angle
Mounts onto bar end of handle bar
Fits inside handlebars with 13.75 to 22.5 inside diameters
